original_title: Sri Lanka to give 7-day grace period for foreigners overstaying visas
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – A parliamentary panel has approved a recommendation by the Minister of Public Security to give a grace period of 7 days for foreigners who overstay visas, a statement said.
It been recommended that no penalty shall be levied for departure at an approved port of the
Sri Lanka currently charges a 500 dollar fine on foreigners who overstay visas for more than 2 days.
The Minister of Public Security has recommended that the no penalty be charged at an airport or port if a foreigner leaves within 7 days of a visa expiring.
Foreigners who overstay visas for more than 7 days will be charged 250 dollars and those who overstay for more than 14 days will be charged 500 dollars.

“This step has been taken in accordance with the requests made by various parties regarding the promotion of tourism, attracting investors and due to the inconvenience caused to officials working in foreign missions operating in Sri Lanka due to having to pay the above penalty,” a statement from Sri Lanka’s parliament said.
“Accordingly, these orders are to be approved by the Parliament on a future date.”

Under current rules 30-day tourist visas can be extended for fees between 60 to 100 US dollar depending on the country. For Singapore, Maldives, Seychelles, and Czech Republic extensions are free. Resident visas can be extended for fees between 100 to 200 US dollars depending on the category. (Colombo/May31/2023)
